sub_topic: Calculating the boiling and melting points of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the boiling point of Magnesium oxide (MgO)? Given that the molar mass of MgO is 40.3 g/mol and its melting point is 2,852 °C. (Assume standard atmospheric pressure of 1 atm).
message_2: The boiling point of Magnesium oxide (MgO) is 3,600 °C (6,512 °F) under standard atmospheric pressure of 1 atm.
